conclusion: The graph shows position as a function of time, and the slope represents velocity.
The slope of the line in an x-t graph is change in position divided by change in time.
The line passes through the point (0, 10) and the origin (0, 0).
The change in position is 10 meters and the change in time is 2 seconds.
Calculate the slope as 10 m / 2 s = 5 m/s.
The slope represents the constant velocity of the car.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
